# Request for Proposal (RFP) for Energy Services at ECCC National Hydrology Research Centre in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan

## Important Notice to Bidders

Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites Energy Service Companies (ESCs) to submit proposals for the provision of professional and construction services, financing, training, and monitoring for the implementation of energy efficiency improvements at the Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) National Hydrology Research Centre (NHRC) in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

## Trade Agreements

This procurement is covered under the provisions of the following Trade Agreements: CETA, WTO AGP, CPTPP, CFTA, FTAs with Peru/Colombia/Panama/Korea/UK.

## Manditory Requirements

Proposals must be submitted in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in the Request for Proposal (RFP). The following mandatory requirements must be met:

1.  Bidders must be pre-qualified by Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) under the Federal Buildings Initiative (FBI) program.
2.  Bidders must attend the Mandatory Bidders' Conference and sign the attendance form.
3.  Bidders' proposed improvements must include a core program that will provide a reduction in current GHG emissions by a minimum of 40% from the selected base year for the ECCC National Hydrology Research Centre.
4.  Bidders must complete, sign, and submit the Declaration/Certifications Form (Appendix K).
5.  Bidders must submit documentation demonstrating the project financing of the proposed scope of work in the Proposal, from the proposed Lender for the project.

## Selection Process

The Selection Process has three (3) phases:

 A) Phase 1 - Mandatory Requirements;
 B) Phase 2 - Rated Proposal; and
 C) Phase 3 - Basis of Selection.

Phase 1 - Mandatory Requirements

Proposals will be examined to determine their compliance with the following mandatory requirements.

Phase 2 - Rated Proposal

Phase 2 will evaluate the responsive proposals (i.e., proposals meeting all mandatory requirements listed above), and award points. The points attributed to the Proposal will be based on the relative weighting factor and the evaluation criteria as detailed below.

Phase 3 - Basis of Selection

The Basis of Selection for contract award for this requirement is the highest total scoring responsive proposal in accordance with the rated criteria detailed below.
